content:
As an AI language model, I don't have access to real-time data, but according to recent reports, the Trail Blazers fanbase has mixed feelings about the offseason roster shake-up. Many fans were disappointed to see key players like Carmelo Anthony, Zach Collins, and Gary Trent Jr. leave the team, while others were excited about the new additions, including Larry Nance Jr. and Cody Zeller.

Overall, there seems to be a level of cautious optimism heading into the upcoming season. Fans are hoping that the changes will help the team improve their performance and make a deeper playoff run than last year, but they are also aware that there will likely be some growing pains as the new players adjust to the team's system.

Ultimately, the Trail Blazers fanbase is passionate and dedicated, and they will undoubtedly continue to support the team through thick and thin.
